definition: to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Was Federico Macheda's winner against Villa the key moment of the season this side of Christmas?
sentences.chinese: 马切达对维拉打进的制胜球是赛季的赛点吗？

sentences.english: Match point in the second set, came back and save that, then won that second set.
sentences.chinese: 她首局失利，在第二局挽救了一个赛点。

definition: to serve the ball/to tee off
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
to win by a narrow margin/to barely win/narrow victory
opening (chess etc)/early stage of game, match, work, activity etc
lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
